alert.note: Alert for Ellsworth (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:41PM CDT until July 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR MCPHERSON...NORTHERN RENO...RICE...SOUTHEASTERN ELLSWORTH AND SOUTHERN SALINE COUNTIES... At 241 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Assaria to 7 miles south of Marquette to near Nickerson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hutchinson, Mcpherson, Lyons, Lindsborg, Ellsworth, Sterling, Inman, Buhler, Nickerson, Kanopolis, Marquette, Little River, Chase, Assaria, Geneseo, Alden, Lorraine, Windom, Raymond and Falun. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
